meanings.definition: Receiving or acquiring something thrown, tossed, or dropped
meanings.sent1: She was catching the ball during the game.
meanings.sent2: The boy is catching the fish in the river.
meanings.sent3: The cat was catching the toy mouse with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: His words were catching her attention like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: The idea of catching the bouquet at the wedding excited her.

meanings.definition: Infectious or contagious, as in a disease
meanings.sent1: The flu is a catching illness during winter.
meanings.sent2: The yawn was catching, spreading from one person to another.
meanings.sent3: The laughter in the room was catching, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her positive energy was catching, lifting the spirits of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the crowd was catching, creating a joyful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Attractive or captivating, as in a catching smile
meanings.sent1: Her catching smile brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: The catching melody of the song stayed in his mind all day.
meanings.sent3: The catching movie plot kept everyone on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: The catching beauty of the sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The catching charm of the old bookstore drew customers in.
